name: team
description: Name of team

name: conf
description: Name of conference

name: GP
description: Games played

name: Min_per
description: Player's percentage of available team minutes played

name: ORtg
description: ORtg - Offensive Rating (available since the 1977-78 season in the NBA); for players it is points produced per 100 posessions, while for teams it is points scored per 100 possessions. This rating was developed by Dean Oliver, author of Basketball on Paper. Please see the article Calculating Individual Offensive and Defensive Ratings for more information.

name: usg
description: Usg% - Usage Percentage (available since the 1977-78 season in the NBA); the formula is 100 * ((FGA + 0.44 * FTA + TOV) * (Tm MP / 5)) / (MP * (Tm FGA + 0.44 * Tm FTA + Tm TOV)). Usage percentage is an estimate of the percentage of team plays used by a player while he was on the floor.

name: eFG
description: eFG% - Effective Field Goal Percentage; the formula is (FG + 0.5 * 3P) / FGA. This statistic adjusts for the fact that a 3-point field goal is worth one more point than a 2-point field goal. For example, suppose Player A goes 4 for 10 with 2 threes, while Player B goes 5 for 10 with 0 threes. Each player would have 10 points from field goals, and thus would have the same effective field goal percentage (50%).

name: TS_per
description: TS% - True Shooting Percentage; the formula is PTS / (2 * TSA). True shooting percentage is a measure of shooting efficiency that takes into account field goals, 3-point field goals, and free throws.

name: ORB_per
description: ORB% - Offensive Rebound Percentage (available since the 1970-71 season in the NBA); the formula is 100 * (ORB * (Tm MP / 5)) / (MP * (Tm ORB + Opp DRB)). Offensive rebound percentage is an estimate of the percentage of available offensive rebounds a player grabbed while he was on the floor.

name: DRB_per
description: DRB% - Defensive Rebound Percentage (available since the 1970-71 season in the NBA); the formula is 100 * (DRB * (Tm MP / 5)) / (MP * (Tm DRB + Opp ORB)). Defensive rebound percentage is an estimate of the percentage of available defensive rebounds a player grabbed while he was on the floor.

name: AST_per
description: AST% - Assist Percentage (available since the 1964-65 season in the NBA); the formula is 100 * AST / (((MP / (Tm MP / 5)) * Tm FG) - FG). Assist percentage is an estimate of the percentage of teammate field goals a player assisted while he was on the floor.

name: TO_per
description: TOV% - Turnover Percentage (available since the 1977-78 season in the NBA); the formula is 100 * TOV / (FGA + 0.44 * FTA + TOV). Turnover percentage is an estimate of turnovers per 100 plays.

name: FTM
description: Free Throws

name: FTA
description: Free Throw Attempts

name: FT_per
description: Free Throw Percentage; the formula is FTM / FTA.

name: twoPM
description: 2P - 2-Point Field Goals

name: twoPA
description: 2PA - 2-Point Field Goal Attempts

name: twoP_per
description: 2P% - 2-Point Field Goal Percentage; the formula is 2P / 2PA.

name: TPM
description: 3P - 3-Point Field Goals (available since the 1979-80 season in the NBA)

name: TPA
description: 3PA - 3-Point Field Goal Attempts (available since the 1979-80 season in the NBA)

name: TP_per
description: 3P% - 3-Point Field Goal Percentage (available since the 1979-80 season in the NBA); the formula is 3P / 3PA.

name: blk_per
description: BLK% - Block Percentage (available since the 1973-74 season in the NBA); the formula is 100 * (BLK * (Tm MP / 5)) / (MP * (Opp FGA - Opp 3PA)). Block percentage is an estimate of the percentage of opponent two-point field goal attempts blocked by the player while he was on the floor.

name: stl_per
description: STL% - Steal Percentage (available since the 1973-74 season in the NBA); the formula is 100 * (STL * (Tm MP / 5)) / (MP * Opp Poss). Steal Percentage is an estimate of the percentage of opponent possessions that end with a steal by the player while he was on the floor.

name: yr
description: Student’s year of study: `Fr` for freshmen, `So` for sophomores, `Jr` for juniors, `Sr` for seniors

name: ht
description: Height of student

name: num
description: Player's number

name: porpag
description: Points Over Replacement Per Adjusted Game

name: adjoe
description: AdjO – Adjusted offensive efficiency – An estimate of the offensive efficiency (points scored per 100 possessions) a team would have against the average D-I defense.

name: year
description: Season's year

name: type
description: Type of metrics displayed: `All` for all types, `C` for conference`, `NC` for non-conference, `PC` for pre-conference tour, `R` for regular season, `P` for post-season, `T` for NCAA

name: Rec_Rank
description: Recruiting rank i.e. what the player was ranked as a recruit coming out of high school

name: ast_tov
description: Ratio Assists against Turnovers

name: rimmade
description: Shots made at or near the rim

name: rimmade_rimmiss
description: Sum of Shots made at or near the rim and Shots missed

name: midmade
description: Two point shots that were not made at or near the rim

name: midmade_midmiss
description: Sum of Two point shots that were not made at or near the rim and Shots missed

name: rim_ratio
description: Ratio between Shots made at or near the rim against Shots missed

name: mid_ratio
description: Ratio between Two point shots that were not made at or near the rim and Shots missed

name: dunksmade
description: Dunks made

name: dunksmiss_dunksmade
description: Sum of Dunks made and Dunks missed

name: dunks_ratio
description: Ratio between Dunks made and Dunks missed

name: pick
description: Order of NBA draft

name: drtg
description: DRtg - Defensive Rating (available since the 1973-74 season in the NBA); for players and teams it is points allowed per 100 posessions. This rating was developed by Dean Oliver, author of Basketball on Paper. Please see the article Calculating Individual Offensive and Defensive Ratings for more information.

name: adrtg
description: Adjusted DRtg

name: dporpag
description: Asdjusted porpag

name: stops
description: Stops - Stops; Dean Oliver's measure of individual defensive stops. Please see the article Calculating Individual Offensive and Defensive Ratings for more information.

name: bpm
description: BPM - Estimate the player’s contribution in points above league average per 100 possessions played

name: obpm
description: Offensive BPM

name: dbpm
description: Defensive BPM

name: gbpm
description: BPM 2.0

name: mp
description: MP - Minutes Played (available since the 1951-52 season)

name: ogbpm
description: Offensive BPM 2.0

name: dgbpm
description: Defensive BPM 2.0

name: oreb
description: ORB - Offensive Rebounds (available since the 1973-74 season in the NBA)

name: dreb
description: DRB - Defensive Rebounds (available since the 1973-74 season in the NBA)

name: treb
description: TRB - Total Rebounds (available since the 1950-51 season)

name: ast
description: AST - Assists

name: stl
description: STL - Steals (available since the 1973-74 season in the NBA)

name: blk
description: BLK - Blocks (available since the 1973-74 season in the NBA)

name: pts
description: PTS - Points

name: player_id
description: Unique identifier of player

name: drafted
description: Target - Was the player drafted at the end of the season
